related-activity.ref: 0810/A0/05/883 OUTCOME 3. CHILD SURVIVAL AND DEVELOPMENT - HIV/AIDS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, populations in targeted communities in priority regions have the knowledge to address the issue of stigma and discrimination for PLWHA and OVC and support community solidarity mechanisms

description.narrative: The 244 psychosocial counsellors assigned to the health facilities with the largest active caseload of people living with HIV, and the work of the 72 HIV-positive women leaders, and 52 men champions at the community level helped to reduce the fear of stigma and discrimination for pregnant women, young women and adolescents; and increased participation in antenatal care, HIV testing and antiretroviral therapy. 18,530 people, mostly youth and adolescents were counselled by the Network of HIV positive people (RNTAP ), and 3,417 people were referred to health facilities for care. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020
